page.title: 03Health Care in Hartington
page.content: {Hartington}has a health centre at Church St. which serves the village and surrounding area, 200 square miles in all. This covers Derbyshire and Staffordshire. There are two doctors and because the practice see people from two health authorities, there are two district nurses. Medicines are dispensed at the surgery because there is no local chemist shop. Patients can be seen at 14 open surgeries in Hartington or at the 4 per week held at Longnor. There is also an appointment system from 9 to 10 each morning. Besides an ante-natal clinic there is a baby clinic which sees babies and children for immunisation and general health advice.
